YML0106-d-09-06-10-NSWS.Narrative: ON 09-06-10 YML01-06 CREW MOVED CARS AND POWER CONSIST FROM SUPPORT YARD TO NORTH YARD VIA A CROSSOVER FROM S. LEAD (110) TO N. LEAD (109) ON EAST END OF YARD. THE CONDUCTOR FAILED TO LINE BOTH CROSSOVER SWITCHES FOR SAME DIRECTION OF MOVEMENT AFTER THE MOVE WAS COMPLETED. YML01-06 BEGAN A SECOND MOVE ON A DIFFERENT POWER CONSIST AND PROCEEDED WITH A SWITCH MOVE TO PULL 12 LOADS OUT OF 857. THE ENGINEER FAILED TO RECOGNIZE THE CROSSOVER SWITCH LINED AGAINST HIS MOVE, RESULTING IN A RUN THROUGH SWITCH. THE MOVE PULLED 5 CARS THROUGH THE SWITCH AND STOPPED WITH THE 6TH CAR'S EAST TRUCKS THROUGHTHE SWITCH AND IT'S WEST TRUCKS ON THE CROSSOVER. THE CREW REVERSE MOVEMENT APPROXIMATELY 500 FT RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF THE 6TH AND 7TH RAILCARS.

683716-d-09-14-10-IC.Narrative: TRACK MA 12 WITH 30 CARS ROLLED NORTH OUT OF MA 12 RAKING THE REAR CAR ON TRAIN R96791-14. AS A RESULT OF THE RAKING, THE REAR CAR DDTX 620186 DERAILED AS WELL AS THE CAR THAT IMPACTED IT, DDTX 756919. UPON INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT IT WAS FOUND THAT JOB R97291-14 HAD PREVIOUSLY SHOVED TRACK MA 12 TWENTY CARS SOUTH INTO THE TRACK. THE BRAKEMAN THEN APPLIED TWO LIGHT HANDBRAKES TO TWO INTERMODAL CARS AND MADE THE DETERMINATION THAT THE CUT WAS STATIONARY. THEY PULLED OUT OF THE TRACK AND STARTED TO KICK A CAR INTO THE "CC" TRACK. AFTER APPROXIMATELY 5 MINUTES THE CUT OF CARS STANDING ON THE TRACK MA 12 ROLLED OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF R96791-14 AS IT DEPARTED ON TRACK MA09. THE CAUSE WASDETERMINED TO BE INSUFFICIENT NUMBER OF HAND BRAKES APPLIED TO HOLD THE 30 CARS ON GRADE. THE BRAKEMAN WAS TESTED FOR CAUSE AND REMOVED FROM SERVICE.

33F091021-d-09-16-10-GRW.Narrative: THE CREW PULLED NINE (9) LOADED COKE CARS FROM 17A AND PROCEEDED SOUTH DOWN THE CENTER TRACK (#2 STATION LEAD) WITH GRW LOCOMOTIVE 307-T8.  THE YARD-FOREMAN WAS POSITIONED ON THE LOCOMOTIVE PROVIDINGPOINT PROTECTION WHILE THE HELPER WAS POSITIONED AT THE FOUR (4) NEW YARD SWITCH.  THE YARD-FOREMANWAS IN CONTROL OF THE MOVEMENT.  HE STATED THAT HE STOPPED MOVEMENT ONCE HE HEARD SOME NOISE AND NOTICED THE CARS OFF THE RAIL.  THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP APPROXIMATELY THREE (3) CAR LENGTHS SOUTH OF THE 15A SWITCH.  THE TRACK IN QUESTION WAS INSPECTED AND WAS FOUND TO HAVE WIDE GAUGE ON THE EAST ENDOF THE 15A FROG.

682969-d-09-07-10-IC.Primary Accident Cause: Lateral drawbar force on curve excessive, train make-up
682969-d-09-07-10-IC.Accident Cause: Lateral drawbar force on curve excessive, train make-up
682969-d-09-07-10-IC.Narrative: M39291-07 WAS DEPARTING MARKHAM YARD USING #4 THOROFARE. AS THE CARMEN WERE ROLLING BY THE TRAIN THEY NOTICED THAT CARS HAD BRAKES SET UP AND THEY INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO STOP. WHEN THE ENGINEER STOPPED HE MADE A FULL SERVICE BRAKE REDUCTION AND APPLIED THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE TO STOP. AFTER STOPPING THE TRAIN, THE CREW SET AND RELEASED THE BRAKES AND THEN PROCEEDED. THE TRAIN PROCEEDED APPROX. 770' AND WENT INTO EMERGENCY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE TRAIN, THE CONDUCTOR FOUND 16 CARS DERAILED. CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE WHEEL LIFT ON TTYX 157170 DUE TO LATERAL FORCES ON TANGENT TRACK DUE TO DESCENDING GRADE OF 0.3% AND ASCENDING GRADE OF 0.25% IN THE MIDDLE OF THE #4 THOROFARE. FIRST 78 CARS IN TRAIN CONSISTED OF 4938 TONS AND LAST SET OF CARS TOTALED 4584 TONS. INSTRUCTIONS WILL BE ISSUED REGARDING PLACEMENT OF LOAD AND EMPTY CAR DISTRIBUTION ON OUTBOUND TRAIN CONSIST. DERAILED WERE TWO HAZMAT CARS: TILX-261878 LD (ASPHALT BY-PRODUCT) AND PROX 28035 EMPTY RESIDUE LAST CONTAINED CHLORINE. THIS CAR REPORTEDLY ON ITS SIDE, NO PRODUCT REPORTED LEAKING. CARS DERAILED: TTYX 962611,TTYX 963563, CN 668292, TTYX 157170, TILX 261878, FURX 828922, PROX 28035, CN 405817, CNA 405862, CNA 409298,CN 407726, DWC 409713, CNA 405715, AOK 111864, WC 21512, TTGX 700933.

685337-d-09-30-10-DMIR.Narrative: LOADED TACONITE TRAIN U78982-30, WITH 3 ENGINES AND 116 LOADS, WAS TRAVELING SOUTHWARD AT APPROX. 14MPH ON CWR MAIN LINE TRACK WHEN THEY STRUCK AN EMPTY TACONITE TRAIN, U78983-30, WITH 3 ENGINES AND118 EMPTIES, WHICH HAS TRAVELING NORTHWARD AT APPROX. 29 MPH ON THE SAME TRACK. INVESTIGATION INTO THE COLLISION FOUND TRAIN U78982-30 HAD AUTHORITY REQUIRING THEM TO WAIT UNTIL AFTER THE ARRIVAL OF U78983-30 AT HIGHLAND BEFORE PROCEEDING SOUTHWARD. U78982-30 FAILED TO WAIT AND THAT CAUSED BOTH TRAINS TO OCCUPY THE SAME TRACK GOING IN OPPOSITE DIRECTION. THE COLLUSION DERAILED A TOTAL OF 3 LOCOMOTIVES AND 14 CARS ON THE TWO TRAINS INVOLVED. HOWEVER, ALL 6 LOCOMOTIVES SUSTAINED SUBSTANTIAL DAMAGEAND WERE DESTROYED. THERE WERE A TOTAL OF 5 EMPLOYEES INJURED IN THIS COLLUSION - THREE ON TRAIN U78982-30 AND TWO ON TRAIN U78983-30. TESTING WAS DONE ON THE EMPLOYEES INVOLVED.
